briefdescription.para: Create a new proxy, called by the system.

parameterdescription.para: the proxy ID

parameterdescription.para: args to pass to the message constructor

parameterdescription.para: the reduction message
the callback to trigger after the reduction is finished
the stamp to identify the reduction

the stamp to identify the reduction

briefdescription.para: Get raw pointer to the local object instance residing on the current node.

simplesect.para: Do not hold this raw pointer longer than the object group lifetime. Once the object group is destroyed the pointer will no longer be valid.

briefdescription.para: Get the underlying proxy bits that are used to identify the objgroup.
Register the base class type for this objgroup, returning a valid proxy to operate on the base.
Downcast the proxy.

simplesect.para: In most cases this should not be called by users. It can have dangerous behavior depending on how its used. Use registerBaseCollective to get a proxy to the base.
the typed proxy to the base

briefdescription.para: Upcast the proxy.

simplesect.para: In most cases this should not be called by users. It can have dangerous behavior depending on how its used. Use registerBaseCollective to get a proxy to the base.
the typed proxy to the derived

briefdescription.para: Collective destroy this objgroup instance on all nodes.
Make a new RDMA handle for this objgroupa collective invocation.

parameterdescription.para: the local count of T for this handle
whether all handles have the same count

briefdescription.para: Destroy an RDMA handle created from this objgroup.

parameterdescription.para: the handle to destroy

memberdef.name: makeHandleSetRDMA

briefdescription.para: Make a new set of RDMA handles for this objgroupa collective invocation. This is the overload for a potentially sparse set of handles with a non-zero starting index.

parameterdescription.para: the largest lookup key on any node
a map of the handles and corresponding counts to create
whether all handles have the same count

memberdef.argsstring: (int32_t max_elm, std::vector< std::size_t > const &vec, bool is_uniform) const
memberdef.name: makeHandleSetRDMA

briefdescription.para: Make a new set of RDMA handles for this objgroupa collective invocation. This is the overload for a dense, start at zero set of handles to create.

parameterdescription.para: the largest lookup key on any node
a vector of the handle counts to create
whether all handles have the same count

briefdescription.para: Destroy a set of RDMA handles created from this objgroup.

parameterdescription.para: the handle set to destroy

briefdescription.para: Index the proxy to get the element proxy for a particular node.

parameterdescription.para: the desired node

simplesect.para: an indexed proxy to that node

briefdescription.para: Index the proxy to get the element proxy for a particular node.

parameterdescription.para: the desired node

simplesect.para: an indexed proxy to that node

briefdescription.para: A indexable proxy to object instances on all nodes that are tied together with a common ID.

detaileddescription.para: After creating an objgroup, a Proxy<ObjT> is returned which can be used to perform distributed operations on that object instance across all nodes.
Proxies are very inexpensive to copy and move around the system.
